attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Full pension rights for people thrown out  of the navy for living with ts person
attributes.background: Living with ts person was illegal back in 82, I was kicked out for this crime but I was 21 at the time and doing nothing wrong under cival law, now a days you get to stay in if you fall in love with a ts.I find it repugnent not to eben have had a simple sorry from the powers that be.

attributes.action: To reduce fraud, Banks must match Name to the A/C No. before Auth. transactions!
attributes.background: Currently UK banks only check if the sort code and account number is correct before a transaction is authorised. This opens vulnerabilities for fraudsters to exploit the system. In some other countries, if the name does not match the account then the transaction is rejected.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must make this a statutory requirement.

Example case: 
MARY has building work done by JOHN. JOHN's email is compromised by fraudsters who send MARY payment request to be paid into an account who they say is under JOHNS name. MARY makes a bank transfer to the account and puts JOHN SMITH as Payee. Because the account number is correct the payment is accepted by the receiving bank. The actual account holder is JOE BLOG. Money is immediately withdrawn. The banks do not reimburse Mary.

attributes.action: All shops and restaurants to operate Sunday hours and close on bank holidays
attributes.background:
All retail stores and restaurants should operate on Sunday trading hours every Sunday and should close on bank holidays.

It is not fair that retail and hospitality share the inequality of still having to work while other professions and areas of industry  still take the day as rest.

attributes.action: Demand an enquiry into the effectiveness of petitioning the government.
attributes.background: An enquiry is needed into the effectiveness of the government's own petition website. Does either parliament or government actually act on these petitions or merely go though the motions?
attributes.additional_details: Having utilised this site for a while it appears that a responce is given laying out parliamentary opinion and later a "debate" confirms parliamentary opinion. This leave no compromise to public opinion and is, at worst undemocratic, and at best an exercise in futility.

attributes.action: Stop female hygiene products being called luxury items and end the "tampon tax"
attributes.background: Despite promises to remove the 5% VAT on sanitary products for women (the "tampon tax") in March 2016 it appears this still hain't happened. Throughout their lifetime the average woman spends £18450 on menstruation. £725 of this is tax. This is asking to end the VAT on all sanitary products.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.mirror.co.uk/money/costly-study-recently-claimed-tampons-6372419.amp
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/12197451/David-Cameron-claims-victory-following-deal-with-EU-leaders-to-axe-tampon-tax.html (the last PM promised to remove the "tampon tax" buy failed to.)

attributes.action: Maintain British roads so they are not littered with potholes or scrap road tax.
attributes.background: Currently the average motorist is spending hundreds of pounds on vehicle repairs due to damage caused by Britain's poorly maintained roads.  Road tax keeps increasing but the standard of our roads is becoming poorer. Motorways, A roads and B roads are badly affected.
attributes.additional_details: British roads are poorly maintained and are in places dangerous.  Local councils do very little to address this favouring cheap repairs which do no last.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for anyone over 65 to take a driving assessment every 3 years
attributes.background:
As many of us know the high way code is constantly changing and some drivers aren't aware of this. 
Elderly people are not aware of the dangers they put themselves and others in because of this, which is why I feel it should be compulsory for anyone 65+ to take a driving assessment every 3 years.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK you're required to renew your licence when turning 70 and every three years after. Yet it's not compulsory to take a driving assessment to prove they're fit/well enough to drive.
I'm not saying they shouldn't be allowed to drive, but make them more aware of the dangers.

Being a new driver I'm much aware of the rules of the road and I'm a very cautious driver. From my personal experience having an elderly person driving on the other side of the road frightens me.

attributes.action: Maintain Freedom of Movement (FoM) and membership of the Single Market.
attributes.background:
Article 50 has now been triggered.
The only question on the EU Referendum ballot paper has been honoured.
Withdrawal from the Single Market was not on the ballot paper and was promised by the Leave campaign.
FoM is a fundamental requirement of the EU Single Market.
attributes.additional_details:
Losing FoM damages business, forces relocation to the EU, loses tax and jobs. 
FoM benefits UK citizens, travelling to  other countries in Europe. 
Stopping FoM damages the NHS. Vital skilled NHS workers are leaving. 
Keeping FoM gives stability to EU Citizens in the UK.
Losing FoM damages UK Arts and Culture. 
The UK is a global leader in Higher Education and Science. Withdrawal from FoM damages its international standing and financial viability. That will damage the economy in the long term.

attributes.action: Clarify if deal on EU/UK nationals is subject to final Brexit deal vote
attributes.background: While UK gov has stated an early deal is desired about EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals abroad with the EU, UK parliament failed to specify if an early deal is subject to a final vote on the Brexit deal in 2 years time, meaning an early deal can be overturned by UK during the final vote.
attributes.additional_details:
By not clarifying this, there is no guaranteed certainty for EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals abroad until the final vote, which means ongoing insecurity or a false sense of security for the next 2 years.

Clarification would help individuals and businesses plan next steps if this impacts them (relocation, resourcing, housing, etc).

attributes.action: Destroy vehicles & mobiles of drivers caught holding device whilst driving.
attributes.background: On average reaction times for drink drivers are actually less than those using a mobile device behind the wheel, yet drink drive penalties are tougher. The only way to really stop people using a device whilst driving is to destroy the vehicle/device and inforce an immediate 2 year driving ban.
attributes.additional_details:
So, a new law has come into force for drivers using/holding mobile devices whilst operating a motor vehicle on a public highway.
A £200 fine and six points is not enough. Even though the new law has been well publicised people still carry on doing it. Also impose an immediate 2 year driving ban for all not just new drivers. Drivers using mobile phones whilst driving are more dangerous than uninsured drivers. Vehicles and mobile devices should be destroyed just like an uninsured vehicle.

attributes.action: Prohibit schools from confiscating student property for more than one day
attributes.background: It is not clear on how long schools or academies can confisgate the property of students. Therefore schools can keep property for how long they want. I propose that schools should not be able to confisgate property that is not clased by the government as a prohibited item for more than one day.

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday to celebrate article 50 and Brexit.
attributes.background: Britain's exit from the European Union is a hugely significant political, social and economic event. It marks the start of a great new chapter in British history. As such, we should celebrate the triggering of article 50 to mark the start of this process.

attributes.action: Teach the history of British Empire to primary and secondary students accurately
attributes.background: When 59% of Britons feel proud of the British Empire, it is clear that education on Empire is incomplete. Changes need not instill guilt, but an accurate and accountable curriculum will instead motivate and educate students to create a more equal and just world. Full petition: http://wp.me/p8vFwG-4
attributes.additional_details: British domination in Africa, the Middle East, the Americas, Asia and Australia entailed land grabs, slavery, torture, mass murder, incarcerations without trial, racial segregation, kidnapping, genocide, war, exploitation, rape, and ecological devastation. If students can study the Holocaust, they can and must also learn about hundreds of years of imperial and colonial violence. The 2014 curriculum update also omits the immense positive contributions of racialized people to the Western world.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all mobility scooter owners have insurance
attributes.background: Scooters are a cheap & affordable means of transport for the elderly & infirm to get about.  With accidents on the rise & with no compulsory insurance required by owners there is very little a member of the public can do to recover compensation when involved in an accident caused by the driver

attributes.action: When selling 2nd hand power tools you must advertise the full serial number.
attributes.background: As a member of the Van and Tool awareness group on Facebook I'm shocked by the blatant resale of stolen tools on popular auction sites. Selling tools with a compulsory Serial number would make tracing stolen tools easier and make steeling them less attractive
attributes.additional_details: Every day I see people posting how their van was broken into and their tools stolen. These are then sold on the popular auction websites. Most  tools for sale could be legitimate and the vendor would  have no problem advertising the serial number. The harder stolen tools are to sale and more traceable they become the less attractive they become to thieves. Ave cost of basic kit is circa £2000 and insurance to cover is prohibitively expensive. Also damage to vehicular to gain entry costs £1000's

attributes.action: Abolish zero hour contracts. Minimum 30 hours a week to be offered to employees.
attributes.background: If the government want to show the people of UK that they are working for and representing them then this should be an absolute priority. People can't live this way any longer, not knowing the amount of money they will receive at the end of the week/month. This includes private and public sectors.

attributes.action: Better Pay for nurses just like paramedics
attributes.background: It was debated in parliament in 2016 fairer pay for paramedics because of the work they do. Their pay has been risen to band 6. So why can't parliament increase pay the same for nurses.

attributes.action: Commemorate Women in the Palace of Westminster
attributes.background: On a visit to the Palace of Westminster yesterday, a woman commented online that "I walked passed at least 200 pictures & statues on my way to the committee room. Other than a pic of Elizabeth 1 & another including 6 Henry-wives, there were no women. Not good enough."
attributes.additional_details:
On International Women's Day, it is time for parliament to recognise the impact and positive influence that women have made throughout history and continue to make in modern society.

Many of these women's incredible achievements have been despite the lack of support & recognition from society.  Let's stop that now.

Time to include women.

We call upon parliament to include women through it's hall and walls.

What do we want our young boys & girls to see when they visit? Their future. Together.

attributes.action: Release the 1921 Census records to the public now.
attributes.background: The latest Census records available to the public are way back in 1911. That's before the First World War. There are a lot of people trying to research their Family History but find it difficult with over 100 years gap on the National Census.
attributes.additional_details:
Signing this partition will help so many families to trace their roots  quicker and if we are successful the rule governing the release of Census records can be reduced from 100 years to 30.
Please check out this link and make up your mind 
http://www.abroadintheyard.com/access-1921-uk-census-now-30-arguments-for-against-early-release/

attributes.action: Make it illegal to pay for parking where you work.
attributes.background: Companies should not make their employees pay for parking where they work, it is unfair and you are basically paying to be at work. Car parks are charging ridiculous amounts which takes a lot of money from your wage at the end of the month.

attributes.action: Reconsider A27 improvement options including a northern route
attributes.background: The A27 around Chichester is a nightmare and finally we had some options but not a Northern Route which the majority wanted. The Transport Department should give us new options but the Minister has blocked it.

attributes.action: Allow airport staff with a valid ID to carry 2 x liquid bags through security.
attributes.background: Everyone is allowed 1 x plastic bag of liquids 100ml or less weather staff or passengers. However, I would like staff to be allowed 2 x plastic bags of toiletries as this will help with especially Cabin Crew where they have nightstops away and don't want to take a suitcase - PLEASE SIGN & HELP!

attributes.action: Use UK National Lottery to support the NHS and Care homes.
attributes.background: It's distressing to read and hear about the problems with our NHS services and the closures of Care Facilities and Homes for the Elderly, such distress can only continue for so many if these problems persist.
attributes.additional_details: Alternatively, why also doesn't the government introduce a NHS Lottery which is solely for the running of the NHS and associated causes like care for the elderly?

attributes.action: Investigate & regulate excessive fees charged by companies that sell tickets
attributes.background: I  would like to see an investigation into the companies that sell tickets for music concerts & sporting events, for charging fees which include: admin fees, postage, fees to print e-tickets at home, & charge credit cards fees. I feel these fees are excessive and in some cases unwarranted
attributes.additional_details: Consumers are held to ransom by these fees and they can add considerable cost to the ticket purchase. Fees are charged per ticket, and it remains unclear how these companies are able to justify the fees, especially fees to print off an e-ticket at home. Clarification is required as to what consumers are paying for.

attributes.action: Change the University Maintenance Loan back to the Maintenance Grant.
attributes.background: The University Fee of £9000 as well as the Maintenance Loan. An average student will be paying £15000-£17000 per year. The country could potentially be losing out on many individuals with academical excellence due to these devastating state of affairs.

attributes.action: Stop nurseries charging fees when children are sick or on holiday.
attributes.background: Many nurseries charge 100% fees when a child does not attend due to sickness or holiday. They even sell the session to other parents, doubling their profit. This expense can put some parents off returning to work and make family holidays less affordable.

attributes.action: Debate in parliament, the reduction in Foreign aid Budget.
attributes.background:
I have extensive experience within The Community Care Environment and am appalled by the parlous state in our Country at the moment.

We deliver foreign aid in billions-some of which is squandered-and we need to address our domestic health problems before we deliver this largesse to abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
Extensive knowledge of Social Care-previous Domiciliary Care provider to Suffolk County Council, and on board of Charities.

Evidence is clearly provided of our Health and Social Care meltdown, by looking in Communities, witnessing at close hand the downward-spiralling standards, to which we are subjecting our population, children, men and women

attributes.action: Burglaries should attract a minimum of a five year prison sentence.
attributes.background: Ordinary citizens are having homes and businesses burgled or cars taken under threat of violence. It is time the judiciary put our safety and well-being above the offender. Hand out lengthy prison sentences and provide in-prison rehabilitation programmes to break the offenders criminal cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Then,following prison release criminals should be made to pay for the cost of their prison stay even if they are on benefits. Make them pay a minimum of £5 per week.

attributes.action: Stop all foreign aid except for natural disaster relief.
attributes.background: Use the savings for social care for our elderly and infrastructure projects.

attributes.action: request that the government consider 'rewilding' Britain to help save ecosystems
attributes.background: many animals that are now extinct or endangered in this country have been proven to greatly improve the countryside of other countries, such as beavers being effective flood defenders. to restore the natural balance in our ecosystems, the government should consider proposals from Rewilding Britain.
attributes.additional_details: some of the animals considered to be reintroduced are: lynx, beaver, boar, pine martens, many species of birds such as hawks, eagles and owls, marine life including whales and even wolves and bears, although the proposed introduction of these would require consultation with local residents due to ill-deserved stigma and perceived danger (top predators like these usually leave humans alone). when introduced, these animals should be under protection by law from hunting and destruction of habitats.

attributes.action: Enforce the Consumer Rights Act to protect music, arts and sport fans from touts
attributes.background: Fans are being ripped-off by ticket resales. The Consumer Rights Act has not changed this. We demand that Parliament enact last year’s ticket resale amendment, which provides tougher sanctions for resale websites, and also require ticket resellers to reveal their identities.

attributes.action: Make the Law Society the only regulatory body for Solicitors
attributes.background: The SRA and the Law Society coexist but the Law Society traditionally are the body that was formed on the 2 June 1825 that regulated solicitors up until the formation of the SRA in 2007. The SRA offer nothing different from the Law Society and are just an added expense to solicitors and taxpayers.

attributes.action: Give Au Pairs employment rights in the UK.
attributes.background: Au pairs come to the UK to learn English and experience a new culture living in with a family. In return for ones accommodation, one will help in the home and with the children for a small 'pocket money' token. In reality, this is a job and should have employment rights like all other employment.
attributes.additional_details: The laws for Au Pairs & Host Families need addressing as they are non-existent. AP's can work in excess of 60 hours per week, being paid anything from £35 per week, with no paid holiday or right to minimum wage. The Gov states AP's ''are unlikely to be classed as a worker or an employee.'' But why? A Nanny or cleaner are entitled to employment rights so why not AP's? It will protect both host families and AP's to have employment law to fall back on should either side need it down the line.

attributes.action: Theresa May MUST make statement to Parliament if Trump visit Petition rejected.
attributes.background: If Theresa May rejects the Petition to ban Trump on the grounds of "It would "undo everything" achieved in talks with Donald Trump" she MUST make a statement to Parliament to explain EXACTLY what she achieved on her visit to the US and why banning Trump would put that at risk.

attributes.action: Give a higher bursary to areas that are more deprived.
attributes.background: For some students £60/£100 over 12 weeks to cover travelling cost and lunch, is simply not enough.
attributes.additional_details: New schools are funded for bursaries on the assumption that 36% of students will be eligible, this is the national average. A higher level of deprivation area such as Newham will have a higher percentage that will need support whereas a Sixth from/College/Universities in an affluent area will have hardly any that need support. So, therefore, educational facilities in deprived areas must spread a small amount amongst many students, while educational institutions in affluent areas have more money than they need, which is not fair they should fund based on local needs, not the national average and in special cases fund specific students a lot more.

attributes.action: License all drone operators in the uk
attributes.background: Many drone owners operate their machines without training, are ignorant of the law and pose a danger to the well being and privacy of the general public. For those reasons they should be trained and licensed before flying these devices.

attributes.action: Make all commuting via public transport tax-deductible.
attributes.background: Give Tax Relief to all commuters who use public transport to travel to and from their permanent place of work.  This would help reduce the cost of living to the average uk citizen and be better for the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The employer buys the ticket and money is removed direct from the employees pay packet before tax is calculated. 
This may encourage less people to use cars which is better for the environment.  It can be managed online to reduce administration costs.

attributes.action: Force Airlines to offer nut free meals as an option.
attributes.background:
People with nut allergies can die of anaphylactic shock if they ingest nuts. Whilst it is possible to order Kosher, Muslim, Vegetarian, reduced salt etc etc meals. Not one airline will offer nut free meals as an option. 

It should be a legal requirement to make a nut free option available.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a list of the "Special Meal" options from British Airways:-

Type of meal

Lacto-ovo-vegetarian,
Vegan/vegetarian	
Asian/Hindu vegetarian
Muslim 
Kosher
Child meal	
Diabetic
Gluten intolerant	
Low calorie	
Low fat	
Low salt	
Low lactose

The above are meal choices. Yet someone who cannot eat nuts is not catered for. It is unreasonable for people on long haul flights particularly children to be denied safe food to eat.

attributes.action: Increase funding for the NHS!
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis at the moment! Some patients are waiting in corridors on trolleys for hours, waiting for treatment. Nothing is currently being done about it, yet it is risking numerous peoples lives. 1,000's of surgeries are being cancelled. PLEASE SIGN TO SAVE THE NHS AND INCREASE SPENDING!
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is an amazing service which allows free healthcare for all and saves millions of lives each year! Each year, especially during winter, there is a struggle for resources but this year it is a lot worse than usual and risking patients lives. Thousands of surgeries are being cancelled due to there being no beds available which could be causing a persons life expectancy to drop dramatically. PLEASE SIGN THIS TO SAVE OUR NHS!

attributes.action: Parliament to amend the law, requiring all councils to provide textile recycling
attributes.background:
Textile recycling should be introduced as mandatory into every single home in the U.K. 
There should also be a module introduced into schools on the importance of recycling & social responsibility. Communicating the textile recycling message to both homedwellers and dependants educated in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K clothing sector is responsible for more than 3m tonnes of co2 emissions.
consuming 2.16m tonnes of clothing and textiles/year, spending approx £38.4bn on clothing alone.

Households in the uk send more than 18.8m tonnes of rubbish (1.4m textiles) to landfill every year-2m tonnes more than EU counterparts.

U.K landfill rates are growing faster each year, emitting methane gas and accelerating climate change.

Anyone serious about tackling global warming should support efforts to recycle.

attributes.action: Make eateries develop a menu accessible and readable for all
attributes.background: After a recent meal out with people with learning disabilities I found myself wondering why, with all the focus on rights and choice there was no easy read menu. One non-verbal service user had to just eat what was chosen for him, whereas if there were menus with photos he could choose for himself.
attributes.additional_details: It would not take much for restaurants and cafes to develop a photo menu, as well as a menu in braille. There is huge focus on treating people equally in society these days, yet in so many establishments a large amount of the population are ignored. We now have wheelchair access in most places for physically disabled people so it's about time all disabled people were considered.

attributes.action: End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a housing crisis and something needs to desperately be done such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
Give Bursaries/reduce restrictions on brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies; This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

That each development must have a specified % of council, affordable,  single-living & various bedroom houses available, so to meet the needs of the whole community.

A law that after a developer has received their planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build.

attributes.action: Increase pressure to provide vital aid and evacution to the people of Aleppo.
attributes.background: The people of East Aleppo are being slaughtered. Before our very eyes via social media, hundreds are dying from the bombardment of the city. In recent days, the situation has become even more apocalyptic - the British Government simply must do more to help these people, by providing aid and escape.

attributes.action: Force all councils to have an adequate quantity of lorry parks for lorries.
attributes.background: Lorry driving is a stressful . The best way of helping drivers deal with this is for them to get adequate rest. There are not enough spaces in the majority of service areas. Councils should be compelled to provide enough parking and adequate services to accommodate the amount of traffic.
attributes.additional_details: There are not enough lorry parks in the UK and the vast majority of them have woefully poor services such as showers and decent food vendors. The majority of them have fast food outlets which encourages unhealthy eating etc. Getting proper rest areas would make the roads safer and provide good business opportunities as almost all haulage firms are prepared to pay the fees.

attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Make the use of automatic renewals for insurance and other services illegal.
attributes.background: Automatic renewals are used extensively in the insurance market. They are not however confined to insurance services, and you may find things such as annual gym memberships and even dating agencies will automatically renew your contract and take money from your account without prior warning.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I've spoken to have incurred bank charges as a result of auto renewal payments being declined due to there being insufficient funds in their accounts. In many instances this is due to those people having no knowledge that a payment was about to be taken without prior warning.

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence to not report child abuse to the police.
attributes.background: many hundreds of children have suffered and continue to suffer because of institutional doubt.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is of course supported by the often late action of hundreds of whistle-blowers who should have reported their feelings much earlier than they did. This petition would remove both doubt and onus by making a legally required course of action perfectly clear to all concerned.

attributes.action: Help release Iranian prisoner of conscience kept in solitary confinement 6 years
attributes.background: I am a student of Mohammad Ali Taheri and I was arrested in Iran in a peaceful demonstration in protest to his death sentence (UN Special Reporter March 2016 report: https://goo.gl/WWhzjPTo ). I have been campaigning for him for several years and I need the UK government's help to free him.
